alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Latimer; Le Flore; Muskogee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 3:49AM CDT until August 08 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Oklahoma and southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in east central Oklahoma, Muskogee. In southeast Oklahoma, Haskell, Latimer and Le Flore. * WHEN...Until 745 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 349 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Poteau... Stigler... Heavener... Panama... Wister... Howe... Porum... Keota... Red Oak... Mccurtain... Bokoshe... Fanshawe... Whitefield... McCurtain... Lequire... Lake Wister State Park... Briartown... Shady Point... Milton... Kanima... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
